column2: MICHIGAN DMV PERMIT PRACTICE TEST
column6: MI

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. A vehicle is stopped at a crosswalk to permit a pedestrian to cross the roadway. The driver of the vehicle approaching from the rear should:
column4: not overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.
column6: overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.

column2: 2. Road signs that direct drivers to services are:
column6: blue and white.

column2: 3. When driving in fog, drivers should use:
column6: high beam headlights.

column2: 4. This road sign means:
column6: Merging traffic
column8: Watch for vehicles entering from the side

column2: 5. This sign indicates:
column6: A shared lane

column2: 6. This sign means:
column4: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.
column6: Divided highway ahead.

column2: 7. When in a motor vehicle on a highway, it is:
column4: illegal to possess an open container of alcohol in the passenger compartment.
column6: acceptable to drink alcoholic beverages if you are not driving.
column8: illegal to drink from, but permissible to transport, open containers of alcohol in the passenger compartment.
column10: permissible to drink a moderate amount of alcohol when driving with a passenger.

column2: 8. Traffic lights are normally ____________ from the top to bottom or left to right.
column6: red, yellow and green

column2: 9. If cars approaching from opposite directions reach an intersection at the same time:
column4: a car that turns left must yield to cars that move straight or turn right.
column6: a car that turns right must yield to cars that move straight or turn left.
column8: a car that moves straight must yield to cars that turn left.

column2: 10. Directions given by traffic officers ___________ signs, signals or pavement markings.
column6: take precedence over

column2: 11. How many different  classes of mopeds are there?
12. Before crossing any railroad tracks, you must:
column4: wait until the crossing gates are completely up.
column6: look and listen for trains.
column8: make sure there is room for your vehicle on the other side.

column2: 13. This sign warns drivers that:
column6: U-turns are now allowed.
column10: they will soon be facing oncoming traffic.

column2: 14. When driving at night with no other vehicles ahead, a driver should use:
column6: emergency flashers.

column2: 15. What is the purpose of minimum speed limits?
column6: To keep a smooth traffic flow.
column8: To decrease the state average speed statistic.
column10: To allow emergency vehicles with red flashing lights to safely pass other vehicles.

column2: 16. At night, it is hardest to see:
column6: pedestrians.

column2: 17. Who is most at risk?
column4: Drivers who are driving on long, boring roads.
column6: Drivers who are fatigued.

column2: 18. You face a green light, but traffic on the other side of the intersection does not allow you to travel all the way through the intersection. What must you do?
column4: Wait for the next green light.
column6: Enter the intersection and wait until traffic ahead clears.
column10: Wait until traffic ahead clears, so you do not block the intersection.

column2: 19. When a driver is turning and a pedestrian is crossing without a traffic light, __________ must yield the right-of-way.
column6: the driver

column2: 20. What should drivers do when they see this sign?
column6: Merge left.
column8: Make sure the bridge is clear of oncoming traffic before they cross.
column10: Look to the left and right for other traffic.

column2: 21. When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
column4: approach the turn in the right lane or from the right side of a single lane.
column6: approach the turn in the left lane or from the left side of a single lane.
column8: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.

column2: 22. To reduce their chances of colliding with an animal, drivers should:
column4: look well down the road and far off to each side.
column6: scan the sides of the road to watch for the reflection of vehicle headlights in the eyes of animals.
column8: Slow down when approaching animals that are standing near the road.

column2: 23. Where must you position your vehicle when you prepare to make a left turn from a two-way roadway into a one-way roadway?
column6: As far to the right as possible.
column8: As close as possible to the center line.

column2: 24. This road sign means:
column6: There is a traffic signal ahead

column2: 25. Drivers may pass another vehicle if the line dividing two lanes is a ________ line.
column6: solid yellow

column2: 26. This sign means:
column4: The night-time speed limit is 45 MPH.
column6: The minimum speed limit is 45 MPH.
column8: Take route 45 if you are driving at night.
column10: The recommended speed limit is 45 MPH.

column2: 27. When drivers come to this sign, they must:
column4: warn other drivers that a stop sign is ahead.
column6: brake sharply and come to a complete stop.
column8: stop doing what they are doing.
column10: be ready to stop at the stop sign.

column2: 28. Which of the following is true about the Anti-Locking Brake System?
column6: It allows drivers to steer during an emergency braking situation.

column2: 29. This sign means:
column4: The road to the right is for one-way traffic only
column6: Detour to the right
column8: Stay on the main highway if possible

column2: 30. When driving on a wet road:
column4: as you drive faster, your tires may lose traction.
column6: you must be aware that the pavement gets even more slippery when it's been raining for long periods of time.
column8: as you decrease your speed, the road becomes more slippery.
column10: you should follow the vehicle ahead of you more closely.

column2: 31. What do flashing red lights on a school bus indicate?
column4: The bus is stopped to load or discharge passengers.
column6: You must pass the school bus.
column8: Traffic that approaches from either direction may proceed.
column10: The bus is about to stop.

column2: 32. This road sign means:
column6: Wrong Way

column2: 33. This road sign means:
column6: Playground warning

column2: 34. This road sign means:
column6: Sharp right turn
column8: A road joins from the left
column10: The road ahead turns sharply right then sharply left

column2: 35. ________ is the only effective way to reduce your Blood Alcohol Content (BAC).
column6: Eating food

column2: 36. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: drivers in the left lane have the right-of-way
column6: there is a one lane bridge ahead.

column2: 37. Never make a U-turn from:
column6: the left part of the lane nearest to the centerline of the roadway.

column2: 38. A flashing red light:
column6: means the same thing as a stop sign.
column8: means that you must bring your vehicle to a complete halt.

column2: 39. At a stop sign there is no stop line or crosswalk. You must stop:
column6: only if the traffic signal turns red.
column8: after you enter the intersection, if you have a clear view of traffic on the intersecting roadway.

column2: 40. An emergency vehicle that uses lights and a siren can be unpredictable. Why?
column4: The driver can legally pass red lights.
column6: Emergency vehicle drivers are not required to be careful.
column10: Emergency vehicles must go faster than the posted speed limit when it is safe to do so.

column2: 41. When exiting a highway, you should slow down:
column4: before moving into the exit lane.
column6: when you first see the exit sign.
column8: once you have moved into the exit lane.
column10: once you see the toll booth.

column2: 42. The ‘Slower Traffic Keep Right’ sign is used:
column6: on multiple lane highways.

column2: 43. A four-way stop sign means:
column4: there are four stop signs at this intersection.
column6: if two vehicles reach the intersection at the same time, the driver on the left yields to the driver on the right.
column8: traffic from all four directions must stop.

column2: 44. Your first response to reduced visibility should be:
column4: to look for road edge markings to guide you.
column6: to turn on your windshield wipers.

column2: 45. Drivers often fail to see a motorcycle headed toward them. Why?
column6: It is difficult to judge a motorcycle's speed.
column8: It is  hard to judge how far away a motorcycle is.

column2: 46. You are approaching an intersection with a yellow flashing light. You should:
column4: speed up to beat the red light.
column6: stop and wait for the light to change.
column8: prepare to stop; the light is about to turn red.
column10: proceed with caution through the intersection.

column2: 47. This sign means:
column6: You may make a U-turn.

column2: 48. If you remain in the back blind spot of a large vehicle:
column4: the large vehicle will take much longer to stop.
column6: you increase the chance of a crash.

column2: 49. When you pass another vehicle, before you return to the right lane, you must:
column4: make sure you can see the front bumper of the vehicle you passed.
column6: look at your interior rear-view mirror.

column2: 50. Service signs are ____ with ____ letters and symbols.
column6: white; green
